text:
At the moment I use the following configuration file:

log4j.rootCategory=error, stdout
log4j.appender.stdout=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
log4j.appender.stdout.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p [%t] %c - %m%n

log4j.category.upgrade.filters=TRACE#i3.cocos.logger.I3Priority, stdout

log4j.appender.xstdout=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
log4j.appender.xstdout.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.xstdout.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p [%t] (%F:%L) - %m%n

If I output log messages of the category upgrade.filters with priority TRACE or
higher these messages are written out two times. If I change the appender to
xstdout for this category every message is written out twice once with the
layout for the stdout appender and once for the xstdout appender. In my opinion
this is not the expected behaviour.

Although I don't think that this is a problem with my extended Category and
Priority classes I will attach them to this bug.
